author: mratsim
content:
You might be able to use this library: https://github.com/minio/sha256-simd

which is a fork of multi-buffer hashing https://github.com/intel/intel-ipsec-mb

author: potuz
content: But isn't that what fastssz is using? In any case I've implemented algorithms with sse2, sse3 and avx2 for 256 bits and even hashing 8 blocks at a time with simd is much worse than one at a time with SHA extensions in my CPU. In my intel laptop they are better performant. I can't test avx512 yet

author: potuz
content: Ah I see <@570268431522201601> that indeed those are essentially the same algos from Intel that I've tested with at home. Since I have a Ryzen CPU, the SHA extension version is faster, but indeed I'd expect avx2 or avx512 to be faster on not so new Intel CPUs
